column1: CIO-CI-Access Team, Ministry of Defence, CIO-FOI@mod.uk

column3: Request Summary

Any studies, business cases or other documentation around adopting open source software in your organisation. If you hold any such records, might I have a copy?  Also, any open source software in use in your organisation and any associated implementation costs (broken down,  if possible, by category such as external consultancy, internal time etc).  Finally, do you have a policy on the use of open source software?  If so, please provide a copy.

(1)	The most up to date version of the MOD?s Equipment Programme Plan(2)	The most up to date version of the MOD?s Equipment Support Programme Plan (3) 	The Document that details the outcome of the MOD spending roun2010.

Confirm if it was in fact The European Court of Human Rights which instructed the government of the day under the Premiership of The Rt Hon Tony Blair, to allow gay men and women to serve openly in the military?  Also, can you confirm that the British Government of the day had sent legal representation to the The European Court of Human Rights in order to keep the ban in place?  Finally, do you have statistics showing the number of openly gay men/women we currently have serving in the Armed Forces?

The career proforma for Weapons System Operator and for Aerospace Battle Manager including the typical time taken for professional training and links between promotion and qualifications. Also, provide information regarding the length of engagement offered at various levels of seniority.  Also, provide the average length of service on promotion to each rank from the rank below for Air Traffic Controller, Weapons System Operator and for Aerospace Battle Manager with the percentage chance of achieving promotion from enlistment and from the rank below.  Provide information on the percentage achieving commission from the ranks for Air Traffic Controller and Weapons System Operator by rank.

(1) Provide full written disclosure of the MoD's funding of the following organisations, including how much it pays each year, the total costs paid to date (2010),and for what purpose, and also the raesons for this funding: The Muslim News; Stonewall; Any other religious or ethno-specific organisation or charity within the UK.  (2) How much funding has to date beeen given to a Chrisitian or heathen organisation or charity? (3) How much funding has been given to an ethno-specific charity for the English, Scots, Welsh or Irish with particular emphasis on the English?  (4) If the answer to No 3) is in the negative why has this been the case?  (5) Will the MoD be funding the only English charity, the Steadfast Trust, and if not, why not?

The numbers of military and civilian personnel employed at Abbey Wood in DE&S by grade and equivalent rank between Grade E and 1 star level and those above 1 star level as at the latest times these figures are available.

I have had a cold call request for information from industry.  The caller has requested the type accident record for all Westland Wessex HU.5 aircraft.  The information is to be used to support the safety case for the operation of a Westland Wessex HU.5 on the civilian register.

As I understand it servicings are broken down into work packages for each trade on a daily basis; could I have the inspection cards for the EQ 1 servicing which relate to No. 1 tank (fuel feed refill and vent system). This should be a standard pack, which simply states such things as inspect, examine, remove and replace etc.

(1) In areas where the MOD Police operate how far dose their jurisdiction go from the place they are protecting? (2) Does the MOD Police have patrol cars and can they give chase on public roads?  (3) Can they stop people for traffic violations? (4) Can they carry and discharge (use) their firearms away from the place they are protecting?
Copies of all correspondence relating to OJEU contract award, 2007/s 210-255269.
Request for the history of a former MOD Land Rover xxxxxxxxxx.

Reference committee set up by legislation i.e. The War Pensions Committees Regulations 1990 and, in particular there are to be 18 members appointed by the SoS.  Currently there are 12 members appointed.  Request to know when each of these members were appointed and what areas each one represents under the above mentioned legislation?  In addition, advise when each members term is due to end and when the SoS will appoint further members to bring the committee to the legilative strength?  How are members selected?

(1) For the aforementioned period does the Ministry of Defence hold information which relates to the use of airbases in the UK and or UK controlled airbases overseas for the purposes of rendition/extra-ordinary rendition flights.  If so, could the MoD supply a schedule and or list of the documents which includes the relevant authors and or correspondents of the documents, a brief description of the document and the date when it was generated.  I am interested in all information irrespective of the role played by the airbase.
A copy of the follow up report to Air Incident Ser No. 60/2006.

The record of casualties, killed and injured in the Afgan campaign so far? Not just British but all countries in the Alliance. The frequent reports and parades in Wootton Bassett are very disturbing to people and one point of particular interest is exactly what contribution our alliance is making, such as France, Germany, Belgium and other Euro partners, plus Canada, Australia etc. My concern is that Britain is carrying a disproportionate part of the burden.  There must be a concise list available and I would appreciate receipt of a copy.

In 1958 I was posted to Christmas Island for Operation Grapple: Testing British Nuclear Weapons.  Prior to my posting I was subjected to 'Security Vetting' but this has not been entered in any of the Personal Service documents I have received.  (1) Was every Serviceman Security Vetted prior to attending Operation Grapple? (2) If not: How many Servicemen were security vetted in the Army, Navy, RAF and Royal Marines for operation Grapple in 1958? (3) Why were individuals singled out for this special treatment?

On the 16th June 2010 the actor Stephen Fry attended the Defence Academy College of Mgmt  and  Technology. It was an evening to commemorate the Dambusters. I would like to know how much Stephen Fry was paid for his appearance and the speech that he delivered.

The figure for expenditure to date for all of the programmes listed in the National Audit Office's Major Projects Report 2010.  The data was listed in every report since 1993 for every programme, and the data was collected for 2010, but was not published, according to the NAO.

Reference exchange in the House of Commons on 29th June 2010: James Gray (North Wiltshire, Conservative): To ask the Secretary of State for Defence what plans he has for the repatriation of bodies of soldiers killed in action after the closure of RAF Lyneham.  Nick Harvey (Minister of State (Armed Forces), Defence; North Devon, Liberal Democrat): A study is under way to determine the most suitable location for repatriations once flying operations cease at RAF Lyneham in September 2011. A final decision will be made later this year.  Request for a copy of the study mentioned by Nick Harvey, including any drafts that have been made so far. If none exist, I would like to know what alternative locations are being considered, even at a preliminary stage.

(1)  The cost in each financial year since 2005 up to an including the most recent financial year of renting of SFA across the UK which remained unoccupied. (2)  Could you break that down into a figure for the UK, a figure for England and Wales, a figure for Scotland and another for Northern Ireland.

(1)   Between 2000 and 2009 the Military Aviation Authority reported there were 9 birdstrike occurrences asssociated with military aircraft and helicopters at Dishforth military airfield. What were the details of each occurrence including time of day, aircraft involved, location, height above ground etc?

(2)   On 12 March 2010 the Senior Estates Surveyor for DE Operations North reported that a team in Sutton Coldfield had produced a report from an aerodrome guarding perspective on Dishforth Airfield about the outline planning application submitted by Heather Ives Associates in relation to a Motorway Services Area near the airfield. Request for the detailed contents of this report.

Request for information about the travel abroad activity of a UOTC unit in mid-July to August 2009.  Specifically, about one unit that traveled to Yosemite, California and then onto San Francisco, California.  I am interested in obtaining the names of the military personnel who traveled to this location.

Refernce Non Regular Permenent Staff attached to TA units.  How many personnel are employed in this service?  What was the cost to the defence budget in total, during the last reported financial year?  Is the service to be investigated as part of the forthcoming SDR?
Copies of the versions of the Blandford Garrison Health and  Safety Policies current on 12 November 2007 and also 1 February 2008

(1) The overall annual cost of rent the MoD pays for Service family Accommodation (SFA) in the UK. To include DE (Scotland, Northern Ireland) Annington Homes (Wales and England) (2) The average cost for rent armed forces married personnel pay in the above locations in the UK. Therefore Cost DE (Scotland, Northern Ireland) Annington Homes (Wales , England) broken down into DE, Annington Homes (3) The highest amount service personnel pay for rent. Therefore Cost DE (Scotland, Northern Ireland) Annington Homes (Wales , England) broken down into DE, Annington Homes (4) The rent subsidies paid by the PUBLIC / DEFENCE PURSE. This should show the real cost of renting property from the DE, (Scotland, Northern Ireland and Annington Homes (Wales, England). (5) The annual repair bill, water and sewage rates plus council tax subsidised Paid by the PUBLIC / DEFENCE PURSE.

Would the current Warfare Rating’s Career Manager please advise what number of Warfare Branch CPOs were employed in WO1(Warfare)(GS)(Spec), WO1(Warfare)(Any) or WO1(CAPPS) positions during the period Jun 07 to Jun 08 inclusive?  Of this number, how many have since been promoted to WO1 and when?
The number of C1 and B2 Commercial Posts filled (by year) from 2005 within the MoD sites in Bath, detailing the number posts let to officers with a declared disability.

The number officers within the MoD who have been offered redundancy as a consequence of being placed within the Redeployment Pool, by year from 2005 and detailing the number with a declared disability.

(a) How much is spent each year under the scheme for children of armed services personnel to attend independent boarding schools within the UK (b) How many children are involved, and what proportion of them have both parents living or stationed abroad.
Any plans or references to plans of the tunnels constructed beneath Dover Castle in WW2, particularly anything concerning Bastion Level.

What quantities of the following substances are held by the Ministry of Defence and in what medium are they stored:  Phosphine, Germane, Arsine, Silane, Borane, Stibine, Thalane.  Also, confirm what quantities of the following elements are held and in what medium are they stored:  Cesium, Rubidium, Arsenic, Thallium, Fluorine, Phosphorus, Chlorine, Lutetium, Neodymium, Promethium, Technetium.  Copies of any guidelines held at any sites where these materials are stored as to how leaks or spillages would be dealt with together with any information on decontamination processes.

With reference to DTR:  (1) A copy of any fallback plans that have been submitted for comparisons  (2) Details of costs on external assistance from 2002 to date detailing which companies and individuals have received monies with regard to the programme  (3) Details of costs from 2002 to date of monies spent on the costs of the DTR IPT  (4) A copy of the hospitality book for the DTR IPT detailing last 5 years (5) Copies of any correspondence between the DTR IPT and MP Chris Bryant and former MP John Smith.

With reference to DTR and the Early Training Transformation contract how many MoD and military personnel are and have been working full time on this programme. Can you provide details and numbers of staff currently engaged doing work on this work part time or otherwise. Additionally can you provide details of how these costs are being accounted for and offset against payments to Metrix.

(1) With reference to the SDSR can you provide details of any external assistance being provided and include details of companies and individuals and include costs. (2) Can you provide details of costs associated to pensions provided to ex military officers. (3) Can you provide details of monies spent on infrastructure improvements at Cosford, Blandford and Gosport in the past 5 years.
Asking for a list of MoD jobs that are on the Base here at RAF Fairford.

How many soldiers have been dismissed because of carrying out domestic abuse in their private lives: in 2010? in 2009? in 2008? in 2007? in 2006? in 2005? in 2004? in 2003? in 2002? in 2001? in 2000? in 1999?   I would also like to know if those dismissed were male of female?  Also, I would like to know how many of these soldiers were jailed for the crime?

A listing (as at June 2010) of all recipients of the Elizabeth Cross.  Please advise how often the full listing is updated?  Please advise if the full listing is available on-line on the  internet and if not, when it will be?
Various questions addressed to Defence Estates on work carried out by engineers.
In view of cutbacks being imposed by present government I wish to know the total monthly/annual cost of present activity in Iraq and Afghanistan by all UK military forces.
Information on Welbeck College/DSFC between 2003 to the current year.
A list of members of the Jewish Committee for HM Forces, their affiliations and the appointment process.  Also provide an electronic copy of the terms of reference.
Various questions relating to the unusual peak in harbour porpoise mortalities in Danish waters in 2005.

Details of the number of man-hours spent by MoD staff on the HMS Upholder and HMS Upholder class submarines in each of the past five years. This should include the time spent assisting and consultating Canadian officials. Please also detail any expenses incurred as a result of any service provided relating to these vessels.

From the Information Centre within the Scottish Parliament reference enquiry relating to a document referred to in a Westminster PQ:  Angus Robertson: To ask the Secretary of State for Defence what steps he is taking in response to the safety concerns raised by the Ship Environment Safety Board in their recent report to the Defence Environment and Safety Board [2621].  Mr Robathan: The Department produced a new safety strategy in April 2010 to address all of the main concerns raised in the Ship Environment and Safety Board report to the Defence Environment and Safety Board for 2009.  Reqiesting a hard copy of the new safety strategy report produced in 2010.
The number of court martials in the period July 1 2009 to July 1 2010 and the offence alleged in each case.
Were UK Special Forces on operations in Argentina during 1982 Falklands conflict?
Various questions on Babcock TOBA and BAE Systems TOBA
Searching for 3 components which I have already put into NAMSA and had no luck do you have any record of these numbers.
Patrol Report of the nuclear submarine HMS Conqueror operating as part of Operation Paraquat and Operation Corporate, from 2nd April to 14th June 1982 was succesfully served on early 2007.
The complete electronic solid model of the Challenger 2 tank.
Requested various letters from relocations and pay.

Would like to know if during the period of 1939-1945, the United Kingdom held any weapons considered to be destructive on a 'Mass' level.  Also, if the United Kingdom has ever been in receipt of technology that would be considered 'Alien'.

Seeking clarification on certain MoD budgetary items and looking for a more detailed breakdown of three items detailed in the table detailing RfR1, namely, Land Forces, Defence Equipment and Support, and Defence Estates.

(1) What was the total compensation paid out to injured service personnel paid under the Armed Forces Compensation Scheme for the 08/09 financial year?  (2)      What was the total compensation paid out to injured service personnel paid under the Armed Forces Compensation Scheme for the 09/10 financial year?  For those claims paid out in the 08/09 and 09/10 financial years could you please provide two tables similar to the ones provided in a previous FOI request (MOD FOI REF:  23-06-2008-102550-002) in which you detail the type of injuries sustained and the level of the award paid out.

What estimate has been made of this Department's expenditure on (a) organisation of conferences and external meetings in each year since 1997; and (b) attendance at conferences and external meetings in each year since 1997.
The record referring to a dispute between the Admiralty and Duchy of Corwall in 1904.

(1) The destination, departure and estimated cost of each of the flights for the Chief of the General Staff?  (2) How many Official Service Residences (OSRs) are there in the UK, to whom are they allocated and how many members of the armed forces are employed in the household of each?

How many condition of service searches have been conducted by MDPGA staff at MOD Foxhill in the past three years for staff entering the site, and separately for staff exiting the site, broken down by month.

Operation 'Lighthouse' (a nuclear test) was planned for 1959 but cancelled due to a moratorium of nuclear weapons.  Could you please say how many servicemen were to be involved and the purpose of the operation.
These sites have been flagged up as possible sites for Mass Detention Centres during a Continuity of Government situation:
Information on a Royal Observer Corps (ROC) monitoring post located at OS Grid reference TL56006229.  The post is named as Bottisham after another nearby village.
Does the RAF keep records of UFOs and is this information classfied?

Concerned resident:  (1) What are your intentions for these houses that you have boarded up along Shackleton Road?  (2) If you are demolishing these, do you have planning permission and what do you intend to replace these with?  (3)  What is the likely timeframe for completion?  (4)  Further concerns are that these houses are now getting vandalized and becoming unsightly and dangerous, therefore what do you intend to do to prevent this from continually happening.
Copy of the contract between Salty Yacht Production LTD and MOD - Aug2007 - Aug 2008.
We are trying to debate for the government to fund wounded soldiers.  What is the average cost of medical bill per year for the wounded soldiers?
How much do you pay the wounded soldiers per year?

The cost of the Ministy of Defence Saudi Armed Forces Project Office in the financial year 2009-10 and the number of Project Office staff employed on 1st April 2010, the latter broken down to show the number of (a) civilians based in the UK; (b) military personnel based in the UK; (c) civilians based in Saudi Arabia; (d) military personnel based in Saudi Arabia.
Details of the current number of military personnel by service (Navy, RM, Army, Air Force) and NATO Rank currently posted to, or embedded in the following organisation: Defence Estates; DE and S.

Supplementary to FOI request Ref 22-06-2010-093802-001.  Provide detail of the number of Substitute Service Family Accommodation by grade, type, and Housing Management Area and the average rental paid by DE by grade, type, and Housing Management Area for SSFA.  Also advise what DE currently pays nationally for SSFA and what are the receipts in the form of Charges for Occupancy for this accommodation.  You also indicated in your previous response that Charges for Occupancy are levied as direct deductions from salary, could you please advise whether; VAT is applied to the charge levied Tax is paid on the difference between the Charge of Occupancy and the market value of the rental (as a taxable benefit in kind).
(1) Details of the amount of money the ministry spends on subsidised food and drink for staff.  (2) Please breakdown the amount the ministry spends on subsidised food and drink by outlet.

Advise on the following; the number of military personnel, by service (i.e Army, Navy, Airforce), whose salary is above ?100K per annum.  Of those the number, by service, whose salary is above ?120K,  Of those the number, by service, whose salary is above ?150K,
The current number of military personnel, by service, at NATO Rank OF5 or higher. The number of military personnel, by service, at NATO Rank OF5 or higher in FY 2000/01 and FY 2005/06.
The current strength of the UK Armed Forces by service (i.e. Navy, Royal Marine, Airforce, Army).
Details with name, position held of all employees including armed forces in receipt of salaries greater than the Prime Minister's (currently ?240,000).
Please publish on specified web site, which Department runs Post Traumatic Stress, Physical Health Repair and Therapy Modalities for army personnel shot with   Directed Energy Weapons (DEWs).

Supply details of any correspondence with the MOD regarding links between weaponry deployed in Iraq and the health impact this may have had on both soldiers and civilians, specifically to weaponry deployed in the first gulf war and the current conflict. By health impact I am referring to any adverse reactions.
Four questions regarding the covert gathering of personal details of members of the British Nuclear Test Veterans and their Associates.
Information on the current number of Military personnel classed as unfit to deploy for Operational purposes by service.

Advise on the following; The number of personnel, by service, who have deployed in direct support of Operations in Afghanistan and / or Iraq (i.e. in the theatre of Operation); The number of personnel, by service, directly deployed on Operations in Iraq and Afghanistan for the following tour lengths; Less than 1 month; 1 to 2 months; 2 to 6 months; Over 6 months. The number of personnel, by service, who have not directly deployed (in theatre of operation) to either Iraq or Afghanistan.
How many missing BFG Vehicle Licensing Office tax discs are re-issued each year broken down by Garrisons, which account do fees for re-issued discs go into and what does the fee cover?
Copy of correspondence between Defence Estates and ATMOS Consulting and/or PNE Wind UK Ltd relating to the proposed Brunta Hill Windfarm, located near Westruther in the Scottish Borders.

Map of Sark re-printed as it is the best map of the island anyone here has seen, but it is out of print?  Alternatively, would you consider allowing Sark tourism office to print the map and sell copies?
How many female officers in the Ministry of Defence Police are over the age of 50yrs at this current time. (July 2010).

Reference a plane crash on 20th September 1968 at the Farnborough Air Show. Please provide information concerning the construction of (a) The Black Buildings and (b) all other affected buildings and disclose in relation to each (1) any asbestos surveys commissioned either prior or subsequent to the incident together with (2) details of asbestos removal / clearance works subsequent to the incident.

Advise concerning the current contract which the Ministry of Defence has for the supply of the twice-weekly air service between Brize Norton and Mount Pleasant (Falkland Islands): (a) Length of contract (b) Contract price (c) Whether aircraft fuel is supplied and paid for by the Ministry of Defence over and above the contract price (d) Whether other costs (over-flying fees / navigation fees / landing fees etc) are met by the Ministry of Defence in addition to the contract price  (d) Amount received for the transportation of civilians aboard the aircraft.
How much money, in pounds sterling, was spent by DSG Donnington in the period 1st of April 2009 to 1st of April 2010, on agency workers carrying out HGV and LGV driving duties.

Is there a central database of the number of troops who have seen active service in Afghanistan since operations began from late 2001 until present who has either  been treated for or expelled from any of the armed  services for heroin or opium addiction that was grown in that country.  If there is can you please provide me with the figure.
Ten questions concerning the commercial and technical relationship between the Met Office and The Vaisala Company (Finland) over the adoption and use of their radiosonde products.
For the RAF Cranwell Multi-Activity Contract, I would like to know the current contract value.
What wood British military coffins are made of, and if they are lined with any fabric on the inside?
Regarding the proposed defence academy in St Athan, do you have any estimates of how many jobs will be created?
Why has the Mail on Sunday listed the Royal Marines under the strength of the Army.

How many complaints or reports has your organisation received from either employees or otherwise about paranormal phenomenon including ghosts, sighting of unknown creatures, impossible happenings etc, and what actions to investigate have been taken.
I would like information on, and records of, ships, aircraft or vehicles damaged or lost due to unknown causes.

(1)  A breakdown as to the proportion of ethnic minority members of the Forces who are (i) British Citizens and those which are (ii) Commonwealth citizens.  (2) A breakdown of ethnic minority representation per Regiment and Brigade.

I am researching the global incidence of traumatic brain injury/concussion. In particular, I am in need of statistics concerning the number of or rate of fatal and non-fatal TBI (mild, moderate and severe if possible) in the UK, Europe, and then on a global scale. Does your organization happen to have this data on hand, or can you direct me towards any publications that are specific to this topic? Any help would be greatly appreciated.  I am interested in both British Military and General Population TBIs.

In relation to assessment for granting developed vetting clearance in accordance with AMP Vetting Directive:  (1)  What specific conduct does the RAF consider to be liable to lead to susceptibility to pressure or improper influence?  (2)  What specific circumstances or characteristics (other than those covered in answers to questions 1-29 on MOD FOrm 1938) does the RAF consider might affect suitability for access to TOP SECRET or other sensitive information of assets?
I am researching GHQ Liaison Regiment and would like further information about the MORSEX machine developed and used during the Second World War.
During the Nimrod (XV230) inquest on 12th May 2008, a drawing was produced showing the fire sources on the Nimrod, prior to the accident.
How many sorties has the MQ-1 Predator flown in Afghanistan? How many lost and number of missiles launched.

A copy of everything held on file in the Housing Office relating to our quartering within the JHQ area, both our previous quarter on Wegberg Camp and our current quarter in Canberra Crescent - under the Freedom of Information Act 2000.
Number and types of animals used in experiments at Porton Down also the types of experiments they were used in.
Request for copies of files held on the requester by the MOD.
What monetary value would the MOD place on the volunteer civilian Search and Rescue Services provided by MREW during the financial year 2009/10?

Journalist of the Polish military press would like to know:  (1) how many soldiers and officers with Polish citizenship serve in the military (2) is it possible to establish any contact with some of them?

Reference AWE Review of Operations at RNAD Coulport.  Provide copies of the following information held by the Ministry of Defence: A copy of the review of operations at RNAD Coulport conducted by AWE plc.

Requester gathering data on all SET related UK public boards as part of a research project and would like to know: Â. The total number of members on your lead governing body or Advisory Council.  B· How many women are included in the total number of members.
Reference a specified contractor and details of bonuses paid.
Details of your policy of  procurement of bear fur.
A full record as possible of the RAF Board of Inquiry relating to the aircraft crash of Vampire F3 VT873, which crashed near Frensham, Surrey on 21 Dec 1948.

Precise number of cases of British servicemen Absent Without Official Leave from the armed forces engaged in the wars in Iraq and Afghanistan, from the invasion of Iraq, 13.3.03, to the present.  List number of cases per year for each year of the engagement in each war. Also, how many remain at large at the present time. Only Army figures needed, not RAF or Navy.  This is for a programme on BBC Radio 5 Live broadcasting Sunday 25 July at 7.30pm.

For each of the financial years: 07/08, 08/09 and 09/10, please identify how many drug tests were registered with a positive result for the Armed Forces in Wiltshire.  Please breakdown these positive tests by type or class of drug; and identify a breakdown of criminal actions for possession or supply of illegal substances for the same three financial years, for Wiltshire.
The number per month of British Army personnel killed in Afghanistan during the last 24 months specifying the type of cause as IED, Sniper Fire or other.

(a) A list of all meetings, plus full minutes and all correspondence held between the Ministry of Defence and the Aluminium Federation between 12th July 2008 and 12th July 2010;  (b) A list of all meetings, plus full minutes and all correspondence held between the Ministry of Defence and Norton Aluminium between 12th July 2008 and 12th July 2010; (c) A list of all meetings, plus full minutes and all correspondence held between the Ministry of Defence and the European Aluminium Institute between 12th July 2008 and 12th July 2010; (d) A list of all meetings, plus full minutes and all correspondence held between the Ministry of Defence and Rio Tinto Alcan between 12th July 2008 and 12th July 2010.

The total cost and number of Full-time equivalent (FTE) staff, both in real terms and as a percentage of total RAF expenditure, for the Red Arrows, the Battle of Britain Memorial Flight, and all other RAF aerial display teams (including single aircraft) (each listed separately), for each of the past ten years.  If the figures can be broken down further, please show costs for: capital equipment, servicing, maintenance and spares, fuel, flight crew (cost and FTE numbers), ground crew (cost and FTE numbers), off-base accommodation and also the cost of any loss/damage sustained as a result of aerial display training or flying.  All split by domestic and overseas display programmes.

For the purposes of university research, I would like access to the following NATO document, which describes a process by which NATO commands plan for military operations, and to which the UK has agreed:  Allied Command Operations: Comprehensive Operations Planning Directive (Trial Version).  Dated 25 Feb 2010. The document is classified as NATO UNCLASSIFIED: Releasable to PFP / EU.

Any information on chemtrails or airborne chemicals or biological agents deliberately sprayed at altitude from aircrafts in the northwest of England that may be for global dimming, population control, weather control, or biowarfare/bio-testing.
RAF Lyneham is due to close as an RAF station in 2012.  What use is to be made of the site, and is it expected to retain its capabilities as an airfield?
Our Army personnel, total numbers serving broken down by UK country, ie Scotland, Wales, England and Northern Ireland.

(1) In 2001-2005, how many UK armed forces personnel were referred  to the Ministry of Defence's Department of Community Mental Health with possible mental health problems that were subsequently identified as having a psychiatric disorder stemming from their deployment to Afghanistan?  (2) How many of these met the diagnostic criteria for Post Traumatic Stress Disorder?  (3) How many met the diagnostic criteria for an Adjustment Disorder?  (4) What percentage of personnel deployed to Afghanistan in this time do each of these figures represent? (5) Provide all of the information for the years 2006-10.  (6) Also, provide all the above information for UK armed forces personnel deployed to Iraq since 2003.
Details of information regarding the programme to develop a replacement for UK's Vanguard nuclear armed submarines.

Provide the name or names of the senior person(s) in the MOD who took the original decision on the Mk3 Chinook helicopters which led to what the Public Accounts Committee said was one of the worst procurement decisions ever made.
Who has the information relating to all official visits to UK Barracks by members of the Royal Family?

I received the below information from the MoD press office earlier today, 16 July 2010: 'As part of the Spending Review process, the Treasury has asked departments to model scenarios based on different levels of cuts. The Government recognises that there are particular pressures on schools and defence, so the MoD is being asked to model 10% and 20% real cuts. That information will be sent to HMT today.'  Could you please send me full details of the 10% and 20% MoD budget cut models sent to the Treasury?  Also send me any additional information compiled by the MoD in relation to these estimates/scenarios?

How many MOD staff have or are due to be trained in the use of handguns or other weapons by Police Instructors.  Please show service, rank, whether training is for deployment abroad including country, reason why training is being outsourced, weapon trained on, police force supplying training and cost.  Copies of documents relating to the implementation of this training including communications with forces supplying training.  How many service handgun instructors are required and how many currently are there. Total cost so far and estimated future cost of this training.

Supply any and all of the briefing notes, drafts and other documentation produced by the MoD Civil Servants in the writing of the answer to the Parliamentary Question (174552) made on the 19th May 2004 to a specified individual. A written answer was given on the 28th June 2004.  I am looking for the material between those dates exchanged between and with the specified individual and his Civil Servants with regard the formulation of the written answer given.  Please include copies of material which you hold in the form of paper and electronic records including emails.

Details of the amount of ammunition issued to Combined Cadet Force (CCF) groups in the UK in the past two years, dating from July 1, 2008 to June 30, 2010. This should be divided by group and by month where applicable and type of ammunition.
How many personal within the MOD police are currently on restricted and light duties within the force but are still working.  How many of these are at Aldermaston.
Is there a level of clearance that we could get that would clear all our employees to work on all MOD bases?

(1)  Did the Wakestock Event Organisation contribute to the costs of providing this display.  (2)  What cost was placed by the MOD to allow this aircraft to attend the function.  (3)  Are measures in place, given the state of the Countries Finance to curtail such waste of Public Money for such private events.
State how many (a) mobile telephones, (b) personal digital assistants and (c) laptop computers issued to MOD staff were reported lost or stolen in Financial Years 2008-2009 and 2009-2010.
A search of the internet reveals that the Ministry of Defence in 1998 ordered the felling of all Turkey Oak trees (Quercus cerris) on all MOD land.  We seek to know the reasons for this decision.
Would it be possible for you to announce the number of our troops injured on TV on a daily basis.  Also who is responsible for sending our troops out on foot patrols.
Details of how many regular officers are serving in the British Army in the rank of Brigadier, Major General, Lieutenant General and General?
I would like to know the value for the last two years of business given to a specified travel company.
